infected the soldiers. The company marched on gaily. The soldiers' voices could be heard on every side. 
"And they said Kutiizov was blind of one eye?" 
"Arid so he is! Quite blind!" 
"No, friend, he is sharper-eyed than you are. Boots and leg bands ... he noticed every- thing . . ." 
"When he looked at my feet, friend . . . well, thinks I ..." 
"And that other one with him, the Austrian, looked as if he were smeared with chalk as white as flour! I suppose they polish him up as they do th
